correctness.evidence: Uses canonical <custom-commands> (L41-L43) consistent with commands template; guide L221 mentions <custom_commands> creating a minor naming conflict.
issues: CR-01 (moderate): Guide L221 recommends <custom_commands> while prompt enforces <custom-commands> (L41-L43); standardize to one canonical form.

clarity.evidence: Objectives, I/O schema, checks, and constraints are explicit (L18-L26, L58-L64). Term 'canonical' (L41) can be more explicit.
issues: CL-01 (minor): Ambiguous term 'canonical' (L41); replace with explicit rule 'Use <custom-commands>'.

cognitive_load.evidence: Well-structured sections; two outputs each provide Format+Example. Constraints list has 6 items (L37-L43), exceeding the 3-5 guideline.
issues: CG-01 (minor): 6 constraints present (L37-L43); reduce or merge to meet 3-5 recommended range.

reasoning_guidance.evidence: Start sequence, checks, and instructions provide a stepwise flow and verification (L1-L5, L58-L64, L132-L141).

alignment.evidence: PO role and stakeholder orientation are clear (L28-L35, L42). Structure aligns with the commands template.

completeness.evidence: Contains start-sequence, input, output, role, constraints, custom-commands, questions, checks, example, and instructions (e.g., L1-L5, L18-L26, L45-L50, L52-L64, L66-L130, L132-L141).

constraint_design.evidence: MUST/SHOULD priorities used with measurable checks (e.g., exists==true AND readable==true; first todo in_progress; ISO8601). One 'SHOULD' is not testable (L42).
issues: CD-01 (minor): 'SHOULD maintain product management perspective' (L42) is not directly testable; move to instructions or define a measurable indicator.
CD-02 (minor): Exceeds the recommended 3-5 constraints; consolidate to core MUST items.

user_experience.evidence: Headings, bullets, and JSON example (L97-L129) aid scannability; minor verbosity remains acceptable.
issues: UX-01 (minor): Slight verbosity across sections; compress phrasing where safe without altering required 'Format'/'Example' lines.

recommendations.action: Standardize tag naming to <custom-commands> and remove the term 'canonical'.
recommendations.impact: Eliminates naming conflict vs guide; prevents tool/parser ambiguity.
recommendations.implementation: Replace L41 text to: 'MUST use <start-sequence> and <custom-commands> with structured children; do not use <custom_commands>.'

recommendations.action: Reduce constraints to 3-5 core MUST items; demote non-testable items to instructions.
recommendations.impact: Lowers cognitive load and improves enforceability.
recommendations.implementation: Keep file validation, todo sequencing, JSON schema compliance, and tag usage as MUST; move stakeholder perspective guidance to <instructions>.

recommendations.action: Make 'SHOULD' guidance measurable or relocate to instructions.
recommendations.implementation: E.g., 'SHOULD provide 3 stakeholder-focused recommendations in guidance' or move to <instructions>.

recommendations.action: Tighten phrasing to reduce verbosity while preserving structure.
recommendations.implementation: Shorten repeated qualifiers; keep 'Format' and 'Example' lines intact per requirement.

advisory_suggestions.approach: Align project guide at L221 to use <custom-commands> (hyphen) for consistency across all templates.
advisory_suggestions.rationale: Removes cross-document inconsistency and avoids parser confusion.
advisory_suggestions.implementation_consideration: Update the 'Naming and Tag Conventions' section to match the commands template; announce in changelog.

advisory_suggestions.approach: Optionally add a concise <workflow> block with 3 stages to mirror execution at a glance.
advisory_suggestions.rationale: Improves navigability for new users without changing behavior.
advisory_suggestions.implementation_consideration: Keep each stage â‰¤3 steps; reference existing checks.

advisory_suggestions.approach: Introduce a CI lint rule to verify presence of required 'Format' and 'Example' lines under every <output> item.
advisory_suggestions.implementation_consideration: Static check over markdown/XML blocks in commands directory.

strengths: Clear, machine-readable JSON output schema with concrete example.
Strong, testable constraints (file validation, todo sequencing, ISO8601).
Product Owner role framing with stakeholder-oriented guidance.
Checks and questions provide verification and self-audit anchors.
summary: Overall score 90 (Excellence). Method: arithmetic mean across 8 dimensions. Strengths: rigorous JSON schema, measurable constraints, and stakeholder alignment. Key fixes: standardize <custom-commands> naming, reduce constraints to 3-5 core MUST items, and tighten phrasing. Example scoring: Clarity = 100 - 8 (ambiguous 'canonical') = 92.

correctness.evidence: Uses <custom_commands> vs guide prefers <custom-commands>; lacks structured <tools>/<custom-commands> child tags per guide lines 221, 426-429.

issues.detail: Tag naming deviates from guide: uses <custom_commands> not <custom-commands> (guide 221, 426-429).
Workflow stage id format not strictly 'n: snake_case' as recommended (guide 219).

clarity.evidence: Objectives and sequences are explicit; minor ambiguity in 'MUST create todo lists ONLY when executing custom commands...' could be clarified for exception handling.

issues.detail: Ambiguous exception cases for todo creation timing; specify detection vs execution phases.

cognitive_load.evidence: Concise lists; ~4-6 bullets per section; minimal redundancy.

reasoning_guidance.evidence: Provides examples and output JSON; lacks explicit acceptance criteria checks beyond general guidelines.

issues.detail: Add explicit verification checklist for command execution success and error handling.

alignment.evidence: Role, intent, and product-owner orientation consistent; language of prompt in English acceptable within file despite guide Chinese doc rule applying to guide itself.

completeness.evidence: Has <input>, <output>, <constraints>, <example>, <instructions>; lacks explicit <checks> block and <questions> where recommended.

issues.detail: No <checks> acceptance list for command run session.
No <questions> self-check prompts for edge cases.

constraint_design.evidence: Constraints use MUST and are testable, but some are process-oriented without measurable success metric.

issues.detail: Add measurable criteria (e.g., 'first todo marked in_progress', 'save report file path exists').

user_experience.evidence: Readable sections, clear headings, example JSON; small tag naming inconsistency may confuse reuse.

issues.detail: Standardize tag spelling to match guide for transferability.

recommendations.action: Rename <custom_commands> to <custom-commands> and use child <command name=... description=.../>
recommendations.impact: Aligns with project-wide tag schema; prevents parser mismatch.
recommendations.implementation: Replace tag names; add structured child items per guide lines 426-429.

recommendations.action: Add <checks> block listing 3-5 acceptance items for execution.
recommendations.implementation: Include checks for todo creation, status transitions, and JSON output saved.

recommendations.action: Introduce <questions> self-check with 2-3 items for edge cases.
recommendations.implementation: Add questions about task file existence, readability, and naming rules.

recommendations.action: Clarify todo creation timing sentence to separate detection vs execution phases.
recommendations.implementation: Specify 'Do not create todos during command-identification; create after task file validation passes.'
E.g., 'Ensure first todo status == in_progress; ensure report saved at absolute path'.

advisory_suggestions.approach: Add <tools> with explicit tool entries used in workflow.
advisory_suggestions.rationale: Makes tool usage auditable and reproducible.

advisory_suggestions.approach: Provide a compact TL;DR checklist inside <instructions>.
advisory_suggestions.rationale: Further reduces cognitive load for operators.

strengths: Clear PO role focus and stakeholder mindset
Good output example JSON for machine-readability
summary: Overall Good (84). Main gap is schema correctness vs guide (<custom-commands> naming) and missing <checks>/<questions>. Minimal edits will raise correctness and completeness; add measurable criteria to strengthen constraint enforcement.
